titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 3ra-114rb).

donors.donor: Several individuals are mentioned in the supplication formulas: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (e.g., fols. 61rb, 61vb, 62rb, 63ra), Gäbrä Maryam (fol. 62ra), Gäbrä Samuʾel (fol. 62ra), Wäldä Lǝʿul (fols. 62ra, 91rb, 109vb).

dcomments.dcomment: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus is the baptismal name of däǧǧazmač Säbagadis (1770-1831).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of extensive use; several fols. are stained with wax and dirt; the text is barely legible: e.g., fols. 7v, 8r, 8v, 9r, 9v, 10r; some fols. are affected by humidity. The Ms. has been resewn; the leather cover has been cut off on the spine side to facilitate resewing. Holes or tears amended on fols. 3, 14, 22, 23, 28, 61. Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires and on the front and back board; the boards have been attached to the Ms. upside down; the boards have either been reattached in the wrong way after restoration or originate from another Ms.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the leather cover (at least 8 tools were used: triple line fillet, cross hatching, double sine wave, interlaced dot fillet, double circle, double crescent with eye, corni-form, interlaced line fillet).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫III፫(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፬IV፬(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – X(8/fols. 75r-82v) – ፲፩XI(8/fols. 83r-90v) – ፲፪XII(8/fols. 91r-98v) – ፲፫XIII(8/fols. 99r-106v) – ፲፬XIV(9; s.l.: 8, stub after 1/fols. 107r-115v).

taunit.ln-info: The number of lines varies between 23-25.
taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe did not use the top ruled line on fols. 53v, 54ra, 55r. The scribe did not use the bottom ruled line on fol. 29r. Additional unruled line above the top line: e.g., fols. 49ra, 58r, 58vb.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; a few lines on the incipit page of the Text, alternating with black lines; incipit of each section of the text; elements of abbreviations; names of Hebrew letters in Psalm 118; some other words, e.g., halle luya (e.g., fols. 9rb, 9vab, 10rab), mǝʿǝraf (e.g., fols. 14vb, 21rb), fǝtuḥ (e.g., fol. 21rb), ʾǝsmä (e.g., fol. 27rab), qǝdmä wangel (e.g., fols. 27rb, 28va), wä-ʾǝmzǝ (e.g., fols. 28rb, 34vb), ṣällǝyu (e.g., fols. 29ra, 30va); elements of Ethiopic numerals; elements of punctuation signs and text dividers.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሃሌ፡ሃ፡ሃ፡ / ሃሌ፡ ሉ / ሃ፡ሃ፡ሃ፡ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ (e.g., fols. 12vab, 13ra, 24vab, 25rab) ፍ፡ ወ፡ ረ፡ ለ፡ በ፡ / ፍ፡ for ፍቱሐ፡ ወንጹሐ፡ ረስዮ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ በድን፡ (e.g., fols. 21va, 33vab, 34ra) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 23vb, 24ra) ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበሉ፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fol. 24ra) ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., fol. 24ra) መዝሙ፡ for መዝሙር፡ (e.g., fol. 27ra) ፍ፡ for ፍትሕተ፡ ወንጽሕተ፡ ረስያ፡ ለዛቲ፡ ነፍስ፡ (e.g., fol. 29va) ስቡ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ (e.g., fols. 99rb, 99vab) ስቡ፡ ውእ፡ ወል፡ ውእ፡ ለዓ፡ for ስቡሕኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ለአለም፡ (e.g., fol. 99rb)

extras.extra: - The names of the angels are written in a crude secondary hand on fol. 115ra. - Two names (perhaps later owners/donors) are written in a crude secondary hand in blue ballpoint pen on fol. 115v: priest (qes) Gäbrä Śǝllase and ʾabba Yoḥannǝs (?). - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 4ra, 36rb, 53rb, 78ra, 86vb, 102rb. - Omitted letters or words written interlineally: e.g., fols. 3rb, 54va, 62va, 65rab, 92ra, 107va. - The word እገሌ is marked above and below by a series of dashes written in red ink: fols. 61vab, 62ra. - The scribe used compressed script: e.g., fols. 45vb-46va, 50vb-51rb. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 3r, 4r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Simple decorated quire marks are written in red or black ink in the upper margin of fols. 3r (three times), 19r, 27r, 34v, 35r, 59r, 67r, 91r, 99r, 107r. - An undecorated quire mark is written in the upper margin of fol. 26v. - The quire mark is no longer readable on fols. 43r, 51r, 75r, 83r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margin, written in a crude secondary hand, referring to the content of the Ms.: fols. 13r, 14r, 21r, 21v, 27r, 31v, 54v, 57r, 58r, 67v, 70v, 73v, 76v, 77r. - Threads have been inserted in the upper corner/outer margins of fols. 14, 27, 51, 57, 70, 77, 88, 91.

frames.frame: - Fol. 27rb: short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; geometric motifs (interlaces). - Fol. 51rb: short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; floral motifs (?). - Fol. 57ra: short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 60ra: short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; geometric motifs. - Fol. 70va: short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
